page.title: 09FARMING - GENERAL SUMMARY.
page.content: This is a typical Dales farming area on the{southern slopes}of the Wharfe{Valley.}There are many farms used mainly for grazing for sheep and cattle, due to variation in grassland and moorland. Some of the farmers are part-time{farmers.}(This means it's not their main occupation.) Some of the part- time farms are sub-let to the other farmers in the area. The main size of a farm is usually{thirty {acrea}with{two to three workers.{Dairy {Farms}have cows which graze and produce milk for the{Milk Marketing {Board.}Some of the milk goes to{local {milkmen. Rose Farm}keeps{poultry}in batteries for{eggs}for local use.Some of the poultry is also fatterned for slaughtering. The{Bull Farm}keeps bulls sperm forzen in liquid nitrogen to be sent round the world. Some of the cows are fatterned for beef.
